Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, MeCripp said:
> 
> 
> To stop the crashing there is a plugin folder in the Soviet pack zip it up or delete it and it will load
> 

Thanks!It worked!!
i feel bad for reopening a dead thread, but does anyone have a working download link of just the file itself? i kinda need some parts to finish my iss

So, where is my love ISS :((

Why all links for download is dead? :(((

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Irenicus said:
> 
> 
> So, where is my love ISS :((
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Why all links for download is dead? :(((
> 

Because this mod is quit old and the modder give up. It seems that there is no working download anymore.
But where I can get ISS? ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

Unfortunately, [@Mike-NZ](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/142683-mike-nz/) did not specify a license in the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>. I checked my copy of the .zip, and it also lacks any mention of a license, which means this mod defaults to ARR, and cannot be shared or redistributed by anyone. Looking thru the files in the .zip, it looks like this mod would need a lot of work, and at least a recompile, if not a complete rewrite for the old BobCat .dll it relies on, to get it working with current versions of KSP.  

If Mike-NZ doesnt return and choose a permissive license, I'd say this mod is truly ded... ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

So, you have this copy? 

**Edited <time datetime="2019-01-02T15:06:45Z" title="01/02/2019 03:06  PM" data-short="5 yr">January 2, 2019</time> by Irenicus**

He can't give it to you [@Irenicus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/151063-irenicus/). 

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, Stone Blue said:
> 
> 
> Unfortunately, [@Mike-NZ](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/142683-mike-nz/) did not specify a license in the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>. I checked my copy of the .zip, and it also lacks any mention of a license, which means this mod defaults to ARR, and ***cannot be shared or redistributed by anyone***. Looking thru the files in the .zip, it looks like this mod would need a lot of work, and at least a recompile, if not a complete rewrite for the old BobCat .dll it relies on, to get it working with current versions of KSP.
>

But I have this copy in 2015 year!

But I reinstalled my system and lose all files for KSP!  ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")
